intro: Plukenetia abutifolia, commonly known as black mangabey, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a unique type of fruit that is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of edible oil. Its botanical features include a woody stem, alternate leaves, and a fleshy capsule fruit. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
